hadiths.english_translation: Narrated by Jabir ibn Zayd: It reached me from the Messenger of Allah ﷺ who said: "Indeed, when one of you stands to pray, Satan comes to him and confuses his prayer until he does not know how much he has prayed. So when one of you finds that, let him prostrate two prostrations while seated." Al-Rabi' said: Abu Ubaydah said: That is when the man is behind his imam, but if he is alone, let him repeat his prayer.

hadiths.english_translation: Narrated by Jabir ibn Zayd from Abu Hurayrah: The Messenger of Allah ﷺ said: "When the call is made for prayer, Satan flees with a sound so that he does not hear the call. When the iqamah is finished, he returns to whisper between a man and himself, saying: Remember such and such, remember such and such, until the man prays and does not know how much he has prayed."

hadiths.english_translation: Narrated by Jabir ibn Zayd from Ibn Abbas: Indeed, the Prophet ﷺ prayed Dhuhr and Asr together, and Maghrib and Isha together, without fear, journey, clouds, or rain. It is also reported from Mu'adh ibn Jabal during the Tabuk expedition: He said, the Messenger of Allah ﷺ was combining between Dhuhr and Asr, and Maghrib and Isha. Mu'adh said: He delayed the prayer one day, then went out and prayed Dhuhr and Asr together, then entered, then went out and prayed Maghrib and Isha together. And from Abu Ayyub al-Ansari, the companion of the Messenger of Allah ﷺ: I prayed with the Messenger of Allah ﷺ in the Farewell Pilgrimage the Maghrib and Isha together at Muzdalifah.
